0.user_question: Gene is sewing a quilt out of old souvenir t-shirts. He has one shirt from each vacation he has been on. Every shirt is its own quilt block. Each row is made of blocks from a different year of vacations. He goes on 7821771 vacations a year and has been vacationing since he was 23 years old. He is now 34. How many quilt blocks does he have in total?

ost_step.1: Gene has gone on vacations every year since age 23.
ost_step.2: He has been vacationing for 34 - 23 = 11 years.
ost_step.3: So he went on 11 * 7821771 = 85,68,811 quilt blocks' worth of vacations.
ost_step.4: One shirt equals one quilt block.

direct_answer.text: Let's think step by step. Gene has 1 shirt from each vacation he has been on. Since he has been vacationing since he was 23 years old, and has gone on vacations every year since age 23, he has been on that many vacations during those years, i.e., 34 - 23 = 11. During this time, he took roughly 11 * 7821771 vacations, which is approximately 85,68,811. Because each shirt equals one quilt block, he has 85,68,811 quilt blocks altogether. The answer is: 85,68,811.

Condition 2: Each row consists of blocks from a distinct year of vacations. Condition 3: Gene travels approximately 7821771 times annually since the age of 23. Condition 4: Currently, Gene is 34 years old. Question: How many quilt blocks does Gene have in total?

1.subquestion: How many quilt blocks does Gene have from the years between age 23 and 34, assuming that Gene made quilts every year during that period?
